page.title: 03Langage Farm Plympton St.M.
page.content: The farm looks more like a building site because they are constructing a farm shop.In it they are going to sell dairy products:- cream,ice-cream and yogurt and cheeses. The farm itself was mentioned in the original{Domesday Book,}and some parts of it look as though they might tumble down.It covers about{250 acres and also includes Combe Farm which is derelict. The present owner has owned the farm for 30yrs.He keeps{Jersey}cows (which is unusual for the area),and he enters cream in the{Devon County Show each year and this year he won a first prize. The local authority bought 20 acres from the farm in order to build a new road to serve a new{Industrial Estate.
